messages: 13f787ccb117049e6222cc4a919e4dbe (20:25): Is it possible to get comletation-alternatives from different sources in the same dropdownmenu somehow, for example from tags, filenames, etc.. ?
4386b8343ff5d028244db6c3d578d100 (20:28): hm, is it possible to have omni-completion always display the dropdown menu, even if there's only a single possible completion?

4f121933e01ce1faf5dbbc2de44e632a (20:30): anyone familiar with vim source: I can't find any bootstrap/autogen script to update configure/Makefile.in files, am I just blind or there's no ``standard'' way of doing it in vim?
4386b8343ff5d028244db6c3d578d100 (20:37): what's a quick way to replace all text from cursor position to a random character? ('<' in my case)
4f121933e01ce1faf5dbbc2de44e632a (20:37): well, ct< if you don't want to remove the < too
4386b8343ff5d028244db6c3d578d100 (20:39): Nyoxi: btw, what are f/t called?  "ranges"?
4386b8343ff5d028244db6c3d578d100 (20:39): k, now I know what I should read.
b714159ea02e81151caf5d2dbf252299 (20:42): Is it possible to have line number in vim... in hex ?
b714159ea02e81151caf5d2dbf252299 (20:48): nyoxi: do you know any editor that could give me line numbers in hex ?
4f121933e01ce1faf5dbbc2de44e632a (20:49): usually editors aimed at hex editing do that
4386b8343ff5d028244db6c3d578d100 (20:50): you probably can write a Vimscript function for that
4386b8343ff5d028244db6c3d578d100 (20:50): not that I know anything of Vimscript

4386b8343ff5d028244db6c3d578d100 (20:50): worst scenario, use the Python or Ruby interfaces if Vim doesn't have a builtin int -> hex function, and you don't want to take 10 minutes to write one yourself.
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (21:03): is it possible to view the wrap margin in vim?
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (21:08): numbah: nope, that didn't do anything either but thanks
4386b8343ff5d028244db6c3d578d100 (21:09): heh, a day won't pass when I don't learn of some new Vim feature.
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (21:11): I've set a text margin at 72
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (21:11): and i'm using gw to wrap text as needed
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (21:11): but i want to actually see the margin
3699931823419db0a821492252442e7a (21:13): is there a textmargin option? or is that wrapmargin?
4386b8343ff5d028244db6c3d578d100 (21:15): there's a color definition for the listchars, appearantly.
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (21:20): the very first color output by :hi
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (21:22): webben, what do you want, like a line or something?
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (21:22): oh, can i have marker or something instead?
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (21:22): but you could, say, highlight the text that exceeds the limit
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (21:23): if it would do it automatically as i type
4386b8343ff5d028244db6c3d578d100 (21:27): tpope: btw, I found it, it's NonText
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (21:27): uh no I told you what it was
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (21:28): it happens to link to NonText
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (21:28): but NonText also includes, e.g., the ~ at the end of the file
4386b8343ff5d028244db6c3d578d100 (21:29): tpope: I'm not sure what "link" means, but when I set SpecialKey to something else, it still displayed the colorization of NonText
4386b8343ff5d028244db6c3d578d100 (21:33): How do I set the highlighting for a group to "nil"?
4386b8343ff5d028244db6c3d578d100 (21:34): i.e. cancel a highlight setting for some group?
dd15de681707f555a83300314483e5c1 (21:50): is there a way to add special syntax highlighting for an javascript library (jquery) ?
dd15de681707f555a83300314483e5c1 (21:50): or any way to copy an allready used syntax and change it into what i need ?
dd15de681707f555a83300314483e5c1 (22:09): tpope: that does not shows me how to change syntax for highlighting
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (22:09): it shows you how to run stuff after a file is sourced
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (22:10): <defbyte> or any way to copy an allready used syntax and change it into what i need ?
4386b8343ff5d028244db6c3d578d100 (22:41): it will repeat the last t/f
09dd385295bbbceb3983f0de471e6ef0 (22:42): . o O ( thing i learned today by idling in #vim... check. )
